comment.author: 41996436@N08
comment._content:
These were called Barrage Balloons. Several long steel cables hung below each balloon to prevent German bombers flying beneath them. The balloon winches were mobile so that the balloons could be moved from place to place. They were a constant feature of the sky over London during the first years of the Second World War. 
Please forgive my inability to post this comment in Dutch.
